title: Brad Zelnick joins Deutsche Bank as Senior US Software Research Analyst
body:
Brad Zelnick will join the Deutsche Bank as a Managing Director and Senior US Software Analyst in Research.
Brad brings a strong pedigree in Software Equity Research coverage to Deutsche Bank’s platform. Throughout his career, he has covered some of the world’s largest and most influential software companies. Brad was most recently Head of Software Equity Research at Credit Suisse, and previously held senior roles in the Software sector at Jefferies & Co., Macquarie Bank and Bank of America.

“As one of the best software analysts on the street, Brad brings over two decades of sell-side and industry experience to Deutsche Bank,” said Matthew Barnard, Head of US Company Research. “Together with Patrick Colville, Senior US Software Analyst, Brad will carry on our top-tier software research and our dedication to providing the best research to our clients.” 
Covering more than 1,100 stocks by over 90 analysts globally, Deutsche Bank’s Equity Research platform delivers thought-leadership content, which is instrumental in our maintaining institutional client connectivity. We are proudly committed to this vision and look forward to Brad’s leadership on the Software team. 
Brad will be based in New York, reporting to Matthew Barnard.
